content.description: Climb the fantastic finger crack at the edge of the big chimney. Stepping over to the chimney makes this route a 5.3.
content.location: The crack is just inside the left / north corner of the big chimney. It's on the north-side wall of the chimney, not on the main face. The crack faces south.

content.description: A fun route that works through a right facing flake into a system of horizontals.  The reachy crux after the second bolt goes static with the right foot placement.
content.location: Ten feet left of the chimney, just right of Phazers on Stun.  The first bolt is 12 feet off the ground above a right facing flake

content.description: A good route for library standards.  The rock is solid but a little lichen covered on the last third of the route.  The crux is a hard pull up high but the balancey second clip may deter some.
content.location: The second route on the outside of the corridor, just right of Nose Drops.

climbs.name: Phazers on Stun
climbs.fa: D. Miscavage, G. Peterson, A. Pisaneschi

content.description: Up the sustained-overhanging crack, then a short arete to the top.
content.protection: Two or three widely-spaced bolts, which need to be supplemented with Trad gear (likely strenuous to place).   Two-bolt anchor on top.
content.location: Thin crack with some curving, passing two or three bolts along the way, starting above the right end of some rather large fallen rocks.

content.description: Deceptively hard climbing takes you past the first two bolts, the crux is passing the drilled pocket.  No individual move is harder than 11+ but the pump and commitment adds a bit.  Can be done statically but its probably easier to huck a couple dynos.  Veering right at the last bolt keeps it 12ish, heading straight up past the last bolt ups the ante a bit.
content.location: Two routes to the right of Nose drops.  Its possible to start as for Nose drops or to take a more direct approach.

climbs.name: Nose Drops
climbs.fa: A. Pisaneschi, J. Nonamaker, G. Peterson

content.description: Balancy footwork takes you through three bolts to the top. Grabbing the arete keeps the climb 11ish, staying strict to the bolt line makes it twelvish.  The rock is clean with a touch of lichen.
content.protection: Three bolts plus two-bolt anchor at top.
content.location: First route on the right as you enter the library corridor.  Use the bolt anchor for the warm up route to rap off.

content.description:
The west side of the big detached block (readily visible on the approach from Paradise). The front side is away from the interior corridor of the Library. 

  This section also includes some routes (e.g. Darling Dainty Feet) which are on the north end of the detached main block (because they're on the west side of the widest entrance to the corridor).
